_examples.MICRODATA:
Derivative work
In copyright law, a derivative work is an expressive
    creation that includes major elements of a previously created original work.
    An example of a derivative work is L.H.O.O.Q, or Mona Lisa With a Moustache,
    by Marcel Duchamp.
    
    Note: this defintion is based on the wikipedia
    article on Derivative Work
